Title: Statuette of a Standing Bastet
Description: Bastet, often represented with the head of a lion or a cat, was a goddess both of joy and pleasure and of warfare. Here, she holds a protective ritual instrument, an usekh-collar surmounted by a feline head with a sun-disk.
Provenance: Dikran Kelekian, New York and Paris; Henry Walters, Baltimore, 1913, by purchase; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Egyptian
Images: PL2_54.408_Fnt_TR_II.jpg, PS1_54.408_3QtrLft_DD_T11.jpg, PS1_54.408_3QtrRt_DD_T11.jpg, PS1_54.408_Back_DD_T11.jpg, PS1_54.408_Fnt_DD_T11.jpg, PS1_54.408_Lft_DD_T11.jpg, PS1_54.408_Rt_DD_T11.jpg
